title: How to Make Paneer Curry in Kashmiri Style

steps.headline: Wash the paneer under running water.
Cut cubes from the paneer.
Add oil to the frying pan.
steps.description: Add the paneer cubes and deep fry them in the oil.

steps.headline: Continuously stir the cubes with the spatula.
Fry until the paneer cubes turn a golden brown color.
Remove the fried paneer cubes from the pan.
steps.description: Set them aside on a plate.

steps.headline: Add oil to the frying pan.
Add asafoetida powder.
Stir fry the spice powder for a few seconds over on a low flame/low heat.
Add water.
Remove the pan from the stove.
steps.description: Add the paneer cubes in the water.

steps.headline: Check that fried the paneer cubes are well soaked in the asafoetida water.
steps.description: You may need to adjust the position to ensure the pieces are well covered. Check again now and then.

steps.headline: Use another frying pan to prepare the seeds and onions.
Add oil and cumin seeds.
Sauté the seeds for a few seconds.
Add the chopped onions and sauté until they are pink.
Add the tomatoes.
steps.description: Sauté them for a few seconds.

steps.headline: Add chopped garlic and sauté the pieces.
Add salt once the juices are present in the pan.
steps.description: Mix everything well and stir continuously for five minutes.

steps.headline: Add turmeric powder.
Add coriander powder.
Add garam masala.
Mix and stir the spices for 5 minutes.
Add Kashmiri red chili powder.
Mix all the ingredients well and stir fry.
Add the Kashmiri paneer masala powder.
Mix thoroughly.
Add the paneer cubes and asafoetida water to the tomato gravy.
Mix together.
Cover.
Sprinkle with chopped fresh coriander leaves.
Serve with rice or rotis.

text: Preparing the paneer Wash the paneer under running water. Place it on a plate. Cut cubes from the paneer.  Add oil to the frying pan. Add the paneer cubes and deep fry them in the oil. Continuously stir the cubes with the spatula.  Fry until the paneer cubes turn a golden brown color.  Remove the fried paneer cubes from the pan. Set them aside on a plate. Adding asafoetida Add oil to the frying pan.  Add asafoetida powder.  Stir fry the spice powder for a few seconds over on a low flame/low heat.  Add water. Mix well. Remove the pan from the stove. Add the paneer cubes in the water. Check that fried the paneer cubes are well soaked in the asafoetida water. You may need to adjust the position to ensure the pieces are well covered. Check again now and then. Preparing the cumin and onions Use another frying pan to prepare the seeds and onions.  Add oil and cumin seeds.  Sauté the seeds for a few seconds.  Add the chopped onions and sauté until they are pink.  Adding the tomatoes and garlic Add the tomatoes. Sauté them for a few seconds. Add chopped garlic and sauté the pieces.  Add salt once the juices are present in the pan. Mix everything well and stir continuously for five minutes. Adding spices Add turmeric powder.  Add coriander powder.  Add garam masala.  Mix and stir the spices for 5 minutes.  Add Kashmiri red chili powder.  Mix all the ingredients well and stir fry.  Adding the soaked paneer Add the Kashmiri paneer masala powder.  Mix thoroughly.  Add the paneer cubes and asafoetida water to the tomato gravy.  Mix together.  Cover. Boil briefly. Sprinkle with chopped fresh coriander leaves.  Serve with rice or rotis.
